title: Fried Plantain & Black Bean Bowl
description: Sweet, caramelized fried plantains paired with a bright, smoky black bean salad and tangy lime crema create a balanced bowl of textures and bold Caribbean-inspired flavors. Quick pan-frying and a simple sautéed bean mix make this an easy, satisfying vegetarian meal.

ingredients.display_name: ripe plantains (yellow with black spots), peeled and cut on a diagonal into 1/2-inch slices
cooked long-grain white rice or brown rice (cooked)
canned black beans, drained and rinsed

ingredients.notes: divide between frying and bean sauté

ingredients.display_name: lime crema (vegan): plant-based yogurt or blended silken tofu mixed with lime juice and pinch of salt
ingredients.notes: adjust consistency with water or lime juice

steps.text: Prepare all ingredients: peel and slice plantains on a diagonal, rinse and drain beans, cook rice if not already prepared, dice onion and bell pepper, mince garlic, and chop cilantro.

Heat 2 tablespoons of oil in a large nonstick or cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat until shimmering. Add plantain slices in a single layer (work in batches to avoid crowding) and fry until golden brown and caramelized on the first side, 2 to 3 minutes.

Flip plantains and fry the second side until deeply golden and tender when pierced with a fork, 2 to 3 minutes more. Transfer cooked plantains to a paper towel-lined plate and sprinkle lightly with salt. Repeat with remaining plantains, adding more oil if needed.
Wipe the skillet, return to medium heat, and add remaining oil. Sauté diced onion and bell pepper until softened and translucent, about 3 to 4 minutes.
Add minced garlic, ground cumin, and smoked paprika to the skillet and cook, stirring, until fragrant, about 30 seconds to 1 minute.

Stir in drained black beans and cook until heated through and slightly saucy, about 3 to 4 minutes. Season with half the lime juice, half the chopped cilantro, salt, and pepper; adjust seasoning to taste.
If making lime crema, whisk or blend plant-based yogurt or silken tofu with remaining lime juice, a pinch of salt, and a splash of water until smooth and pourable; adjust acidity and consistency.

Assemble bowls: divide warm rice among bowls, spoon black bean mixture alongside or atop rice, arrange fried plantains on top, add avocado slices, drizzle with lime crema, and finish with remaining cilantro and optional red pepper flakes.
